chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall a b : Z, 0 < a -> 0 < b -> 0 < Z.sub (Z.mul a a) (Z.mul b b) -> b < a

Premises:
N.sub = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos n' => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos m' => match Pos.sub_mask n' m' with | Pos.IsPos p => N.pos p | _ => 0%N end end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.sub (_ _)%N_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
sqr_sub2 : forall a b : Z, 0 <= b -> b < a -> 0 < a * a - b * b
ZMicromega.Zdivide_pol_sub : forall (p : EnvRing.Pol Z) (a b : Z), 0 < Z.gcd a b -> ZMicromega.Zdivide_pol a (EnvRing.PsubC Z.sub p b) -> ZMicromega.Zdivide_pol (Z.gcd a b) p
sqr_sub1 : forall a b : Z, 0 <= b -> b <= a -> 0 <= a * a - b * b
Z.rem_eq : forall a b : Z, b <> 0 -> Z.rem a b = a - b * (a ÷ b)
Z.mod_eq : forall a b : Z, b <> 0 -> a mod b = a - b * (a / b)
Z.div_mod : forall a b : Z, b <> 0 -> a = b * (a / b) + a mod b
Z.quot_rem : forall a b : Z, b <> 0 -> a = b * (a ÷ b) + Z.rem a b
Zmod_eq : forall a b : Z, b > 0 -> a mod b = a - a / b * b
Zmod_eq_full : forall a b : Z, b <> 0 -> a mod b = a - a / b * b
Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : Z, (g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> Zis_gcd a b g
Zis_gcd_for_euclid : forall a b d q : Z, Zis_gcd b (a - q * b) d -> Zis_gcd a b d
ZMicromega.Zgcd_minus : forall a b c : Z, (a | c - b) -> (Z.gcd a b | c)
Zis_gcd_ind : forall (a b g : Z) (P : Prop), ((g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> P) -> Zis_gcd a b g -> P
Zdivide_opp_l_rev : forall a b : Z, (- a | b) -> (a | b)
Zdivide_opp_l : forall a b : Z, (a | b) -> (- a | b)
Zgcd_is_gcd : forall a b : Z, Zis_gcd a b (Z.gcd a b)
BinIntDef.Z.gcd = fun a b : Z => match a with | 0 => BinIntDef.Z.abs b | Z.pos a0 | Z.neg a0 => match b with | 0 => BinIntDef.Z.abs a | Z.pos b0 | Z.neg b0 => Z.pos (Pos.gcd a0 b0) end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.gcd (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive Zis_gcd (a b g : Z) : Prop := Zis_gcd_intro : (g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> Zis_gcd a b g Arguments Zis_gcd (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments Zis_gcd_intro (_ _ _)%Z_scope _ _ _%function_scope
BinIntDef.Z.quot = fun a b : Z => fst (BinIntDef.Z.quotrem a b) : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.quot (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.rem = fun a b : Z => snd (BinIntDef.Z.quotrem a b) : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.rem (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.div = fun a b : Z => let (q, _) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in q : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.div (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.modulo = fun a b : Z => let (_, r) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in r : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.modulo (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.quotrem = fun a b : Z => match a with | 0 => (0, 0) | Z.pos a0 => match b with | 0 => (0, a) | Z.pos b0 => let (q, r) := N.pos_div_eucl a0 (N.pos b0) in (BinIntDef.Z.of_N q, BinIntDef.Z.of_N r) | Z.neg b0 => let (q, r) := N.pos_div_eucl a0 (N.pos b0) in (- BinIntDef.Z.of_N q, BinIntDef.Z.of_N r) end | Z.neg a0 => match b with | 0 => (0, a) | Z.pos b0 => let (q, r) := N.pos_div_eucl a0 (N.pos b0) in (- BinIntDef.Z.of_N q, - BinIntDef.Z.of_N r) | Z.neg b0 => let (q, r) := N.pos_div_eucl...
Z.mul_pos_pos : forall n m : Z, 0 < n -> 0 < m -> 0 < n * m
Z.add_neg_cases : forall n m : Z, n + m < 0 -> n < 0 \/ m < 0
Z.sub_neg_cases : forall n m : Z, n - m < 0 -> n < 0 \/ 0 < m
Z.sub_pos_cases : forall n m : Z, 0 < n - m -> 0 < n \/ m < 0
Z.add_pos_cases : forall n m : Z, 0 < n + m -> 0 < n \/ 0 < m
Zlt_0_minus_lt : forall n m : Z, 0 < n - m -> m < n
Z.opp_pos_neg : forall n : Z, 0 < - n < -> n < 0
